case_title: Abdul Jabbar Baloch vs Chief Secretary, Government of Balochistan, Civil Secretariat, Quetta and another
respondant: Chief Secretary, Government of Balochistan, Civil Secretariat, Quetta
complaint_summary: The appellant, a civil servant, challenged frequent transfers and postings without completing his tenure, alleging violations of service rules and principles established by the Supreme Court.
investigation_summary: The appellant filed a departmental appeal against the transfer order dated 27-03-2023, which was not addressed, prompting him to approach the tribunal under Section 4 of the Balochistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974.
judgment_summary: The tribunal set aside the notifications dated 25-05-2022 and 27-03-2023 regarding the appellant's postings/transfers, citing procedural violations under the Balochistan Local Government Act, 2010 and the Constitution of Pakistan. The government was directed to appoint an Administrator for Metropolitan Corporation, Quetta within 15 days following proper legal procedures.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal disposed of; notifications set aside.
legal_arguments: Frequent transfers violated principles established in Aneeta Turab's case (PLD 2013 SC 195).
Posting/transfer notifications lacked legal basis under Section 26(1)(a)(b) and Section 129(1)(b) of the Balochistan Local Government Act, 2010.
Absence of proper procedure for appointing Administrator Metropolitan Corporation, Quetta.
sections: Section 4 of Balochistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974
Section 26(1)(a)(b) of Balochistan Local Government Act, 2010
Section 129(1)(b) of Balochistan Local Government Act, 2010
key_issues: Frequent transfers of civil servants without completing tenure.
Procedural violations in issuing transfer/posting notifications.
Legal authority for appointing Administrator Metropolitan Corporation, Quetta.

legal_terms.Administrator: A person appointed to perform functions of a local council as per the Local Government Act.
legal_terms.Posting/Transfer: Movement of a civil servant from one position to another.

words_and_phrases.Appoint: To designate or nominate a person for a position.
words_and_phrases.Government: The regulation and control exercised by political authority.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around procedural violations in the frequent transfers of a civil servant, Abdul Jabbar Baloch, challenging the legality of notifications issued by the Government of Balochistan. The tribunal set aside the impugned notifications and directed the government to follow proper procedures for appointing an Administrator for Metropolitan Corporation, Quetta.
